comment: Approved. Comprehensive coverage of QMS requirements.
Excellent draft. Clear and comprehensive.

Review of SOP-001 v1.1 identifies the following items requiring correction before approval:

1. PERMISSION INCONSISTENCY: Section 4.2 Permission Matrix shows only QA has 'fix' permission, but Section 13 CLI Reference states 'QA/lead only'. These must align. Recommend updating Section 4.2 to show lead also has fix permission, or updating Section 13 to show QA only.

2. FRONTMATTER SCHEMA MISMATCH: Section 12 schema shows 'reviewers:' and 'approvers:' but actual frontmatter in this document uses 'assignees:' for both review_history and approval_history. Schema must match implementation.

3. SCHEMA MISSING TYPE FIELD: Section 12 schema shows 'type:' only in approval_history, but actual implementation includes 'type: REVIEW' in review_history entries. Document the type field in review_history schema.

4. SCHEMA MISSING OUTCOME FIELD: The review workflow documents --recommend and --request-updates outcomes, but the frontmatter schema does not show where/how this outcome is recorded. Add the outcome field to the review assignee schema.

Strengths noted: State diagrams are excellent, version numbering is clear, workflow documentation is thorough. After addressing these schema alignment issues, document will be ready for approval.

All previously identified issues have been addressed:

1. PERMISSION CONSISTENCY: Section 4.2 now shows 'lead only | Yes | -' for fix command, aligning with Section 13 'QA/lead only'. VERIFIED.

2. FRONTMATTER SCHEMA: Section 12 now correctly uses 'assignees:' for both review_history and approval_history, matching actual implementation. VERIFIED.

3. TYPE FIELD IN REVIEW_HISTORY: Section 12 schema now includes 'type: {REVIEW|PRE_REVIEW|POST_REVIEW}' in review_history. VERIFIED.

4. OUTCOME FIELD: Section 12 schema now includes 'outcome: {RECOMMEND|UPDATES_REQUIRED|null}' in review assignee schema. VERIFIED.

5. DATE_INITIATED FIELD: Added to both review_history and approval_history schemas. VERIFIED.

Document is comprehensive, internally consistent, and ready for approval. Recommend proceeding to approval stage.

QA Review of SOP-001 v2.1: RECOMMEND APPROVAL. All CLI examples throughout the document have been updated to use the required --user flag. Verified: (1) Section 8 Workflows - all 9 CLI examples updated; (2) Section 10 Check-Out/Check-In - all 4 CLI examples updated; (3) Section 13 CLI Reference - introductory sentence added and all 20 commands now show --user {USER} syntax; (4) Section 15 Revision History - v2.1 entry correctly documents the change. One observation: the assign command uses --user twice (once for calling user, once for target users), which is consistent but potentially confusing. This is a design choice and does not block approval. Document is internally consistent and ready for approval.

QA Review of SOP-001 v3.1: RECOMMEND APPROVAL. This minor documentation update correctly addresses the confusion identified in the v2.1 review regarding the dual use of --user in the assign command. Verified changes: (1) Section 8.1 - example updated from '--user tu_ui tu_scene' to '--assignees tu_ui tu_scene'; (2) Section 13 CLI Reference - assign command updated from '--user {users}' to '--assignees {users}'; (3) Section 15 Revision History - v3.1 entry correctly documents the rename. The change is minimal, targeted, and internally consistent. Document is ready for approval.

QA Review of SOP-001 v4.1: RECOMMEND APPROVAL. This revision documents the three-tier metadata architecture (.meta/.audit sidecar files). Verified: (1) Section 5 clearly defines all three tiers - Document Frontmatter (author-maintained), Workflow State (.meta/ JSON), and Audit Trail (.audit/ JSONL); (2) Section 5.3 documents all event types for the audit trail; (3) Section 6 updates directory structure to show .meta/ and .audit/ directories; (4) Section 11.1 and 11.2 correctly reference .meta file for responsible user tracking; (5) Section 13 adds new commands: history, comments, migrate, verify-migration; (6) Section 15 revision history correctly documents v4.1 changes. The draft frontmatter correctly uses the simplified schema with only title and revision_summary fields. Implementation verified: .meta/ and .audit/ directories exist with proper structure. Document is internally consistent and ready for approval.

QA Review of SOP-001 v5.1: RECOMMEND APPROVAL.

This revision appropriately removes redundant in-body metadata and adds Section 5.4 Document Content Standards. Review findings:

FRONTMATTER COMPLIANCE:
- title: Present and accurate
- revision_summary: Present and correctly describes changes (Remove redundant in-body metadata; add Section 5.4 Document Content Standards)

WORKFLOW COMPLIANCE:
- Document was properly checked out by lead (v5.0 -> v5.1)
- Document was checked in before routing for review
- Document is correctly in IN_REVIEW status

CONTENT CHANGES VERIFIED:
1. REMOVED IN-BODY METADATA: Version, Effective Date, and Responsible User lines removed from document header. This eliminates redundancy with .meta sidecar files. CORRECT.

2. NEW SECTION 5.4 DOCUMENT CONTENT STANDARDS: Clearly prohibits manual insertion of version numbers, effective dates, responsible user identifiers, and revision history tables. Provides CLI commands for accessing this metadata (qms status, qms history). Includes rationale explaining the single source of truth principle. CORRECT.

3. REMOVED REVISION HISTORY TABLE (Section 15): The revision history table has been removed. This is consistent with the new Section 5.4 requirements and eliminates manual maintenance of version history. The audit trail (.audit/ files) now serves as the authoritative revision history per qms history command. CORRECT.

4. FRONTMATTER revision_summary UPDATED: Correctly describes the changes in this revision. CORRECT.

INTERNAL CONSISTENCY:
- Section 5.4 references qms status and qms history commands, which are documented in Section 13.3
- The removal of in-body metadata aligns with the three-tier architecture documented in Section 5.1-5.3
- No orphaned references to removed content

Document is internally consistent and ready for approval.

QA Review of SOP-001 v6.1: REQUEST UPDATES

FRONTMATTER COMPLIANCE: PASS
- title: Present and accurate
- revision_summary: Correctly describes changes (Add document cancel and retire functionality)
- No prohibited in-body metadata

WORKFLOW COMPLIANCE: PASS
- Properly checked out by claude (v6.0 -> v6.1)
- Checked in before routing for review
- Correctly in IN_REVIEW status

CONTENT REVIEW: ONE ISSUE IDENTIFIED

1. STATE MACHINE DIAGRAMS INCOMPLETE (Sections 10.1 and 10.2):
   The state machine diagrams do not show the RETIRED terminal state or the transitions leading to it. Per Section 8.3, RETIRED is a terminal state for both non-executable and executable documents. The diagrams should be updated to show:
   
   For 10.1 (Non-Executable): 
   - EFFECTIVE can transition to RETIRED via the retire workflow (route --approval --retire)
   - DRAFT can be CANCELLED (for v < 1.0 documents)
   
   For 10.2 (Executable):
   - CLOSED can transition to RETIRED via the retire workflow
   - DRAFT can be CANCELLED (for v < 1.0 documents)

CONTENT STRENGTHS:
- Clear distinction between Cancel (never-effective) and Retire (once-effective) is well-reasoned
- Cancel requires --confirm flag for safety - appropriate safeguard
- Retire uses formal approval workflow - correct for documents with production history
- Section 8.3 Terminal States table is a valuable addition
- CLI commands in Section 13.5 properly documented
- RETIRE event type added to audit trail event types (Section 5.3)

RECOMMENDATION: Address the state machine diagram omission in Sections 10.1 and 10.2 before approval.

QA Review of SOP-001 v6.1: RECOMMEND APPROVAL.

PREVIOUS ISSUE RESOLVED:
The state machine diagrams in Sections 10.1 and 10.2 have been updated to show terminal state transitions as requested.

VERIFICATION:
1. Section 10.1 (Non-Executable Documents):
   - DRAFT (v < 1.0) now shows: (qms cancel --confirm) --> [DELETED]. VERIFIED.
   - EFFECTIVE now shows: (retire workflow) --> RETIRED. VERIFIED.
   - SUPERSEDED transition preserved. VERIFIED.

2. Section 10.2 (Executable Documents):
   - DRAFT (v < 1.0) now shows: (qms cancel --confirm) --> [DELETED]. VERIFIED.
   - CLOSED now shows: (retire workflow) --> RETIRED. VERIFIED.

INTERNAL CONSISTENCY CHECK:
- State diagrams now align with Section 8.3 Terminal States table
- Section 9.7 Cancel and Retire Workflows are accurately represented
- CLI commands in Section 13.5 match the diagram transitions

FRONTMATTER COMPLIANCE: PASS
- title: Present and accurate
- revision_summary: Correctly describes changes

Document is internally consistent and ready for approval.

The revision_summary in the frontmatter is inaccurate. It states 'Add document cancel and retire functionality (Section 8.3, 9.7, 13.5)' which describes the changes from v6.0 to v7.0, not the current revision. The actual changes in v7.1 are: (1) Section 9.1 - Removed explicit --pre-review/--post-review flags, added automatic inference; (2) Section 9.2 - Removed explicit --pre-approval/--post-approval flags, added automatic inference; (3) Section 10.2 - Added explanatory note about CLI inferring pre/post phase from document status; (4) Section 13.2 - Consolidated 6 explicit routing commands to 2 with inference notation; (5) Section 13.5 - Removed --post-approval --retire variant. The revision_summary should be updated to reflect the actual changes: 'Remove deprecated --pre-review, --post-review, --pre-approval, --post-approval flags; CLI now uses simplified --review and --approval flags with automatic pre/post inference based on document status.'

Revision summary now accurately describes the changes: routing flag simplification with automatic pre/post phase inference from document status. Affected sections (9.1, 9.2, 10.2, 13.2, 13.5) are correctly identified. Frontmatter complete per Section 5.1. Document follows proper workflow (DRAFT to IN_REVIEW). Technical content is accurate and internally consistent. Recommend approval.

QA Review: SOP-001 v8.1 correctly implements CR-004 requirements. Section 5.1 now specifies the CR ID prefix format for revision_summary with clear example and exception for v0.1 documents. Frontmatter is compliant. Change is surgical and limited to scope defined in CR-004. RECOMMEND approval.

Procedural compliance verified. SOP-001 v9.1 correctly implements CR-006. Revision summary properly references authorizing CR. Section 4.2 Permission Matrix updated to grant QA route permission (line 63). Change is technically accurate and aligns CLI implementation with documented procedures.

REVIEW FINDINGS - SOP-001 v10.1

FRONTMATTER VERIFICATION:
- title: 'Quality Management System - Document Control' - VERIFIED PRESENT
- revision_summary: 'CR-014: Add VAR to controlled document types, definitions, and naming conventions' - VERIFIED PRESENT, begins with CR ID

CHANGES VERIFIED:
1. Section 2 (Scope): VAR added to controlled document types list - VERIFIED
2. Section 3 (Definitions): VAR definition added with cross-reference to SOP-004 Section 9A - VERIFIED
3. Section 6.1 (Naming Convention): VAR naming convention CR-NNN-VAR-NNN added - VERIFIED
4. Section 8.2 (Executable Documents): VAR added to executable document list - VERIFIED

CROSS-REFERENCE VALIDATION:
- Section 3 VAR definition references 'SOP-004 Section 9A' which exists in SOP-004-draft

PLACEHOLDER CONTENT CHECK: None found
FORMATTING CHECK: Consistent throughout
TYPO CHECK: None found

RECOMMENDATION: APPROVE - All changes are internally consistent and properly cross-referenced.

COMPLIANT. Full verification of CR-015 EI-2 changes: (1) Frontmatter: title='Quality Management System - Document Control', revision_summary='CR-015: Remove DS, CS, OQ; fix CAPA classification per SOP-006', (2) CAPA removed from scope list (Section 2), (3) SDLC types changed from (RS, DS, CS, RTM, OQ) to (RS, RTM) at line 26, (4) Executable Document definition (line 41) no longer includes CAPA, (5) Non-Executable Document definition (line 42) shows only (RS, RTM, SOP), (6) CAPA naming convention retained at line 244 for EI identification, (7) DS/CS/OQ rows removed from naming table, (8) Section 8.1 header shows (SOP, RS, RTM), (9) Section 8.2 header shows (CR, INV, TP, ER, VAR) without CAPA. Internal consistency verified across all sections. No placeholder content. Recommend for approval.
